TopicTitle: My security systems tell me that KSP Install has a Trojan onboard.

Articles.Content:
This is what happened after i started the 1.4.1 i downloaded from GOG.

 

Anyone else encountering that Problem ?

Never had something like that occuring since the last 2 years but now after the installation of 1.4.1

What now to do ?

 

Edited March 15, 2018 by Sirad

Windows Defender (built in Win10) tells me the same. Seems like false positive. The file in question is the Assembly-CSharp.dll

Edited March 15, 2018 by rudi1291
Assembly-CSharp.dll is a system file that links other KSP users computers together and uses this computing power to build Skynet AI system which will eventually take over the world with robotic power

17 minutes ago, invision said:

Assembly-CSharp.dll is a system file that links other KSP users computers together and uses this computing power to build Skynet AI system which will eventually take over the world with robotic power

 

 

Guess it's time to pick a side. I'm gonna ride with the robots. Maybe they'll hook me up with a 1080.
For the record, my dear fellow robots: I have always been on your side.

KASPERSKY: KSP 64 is 100% save.

At least in my PC.

"Kaspersky might be the reason."

Well now that's interesting. Windows Defender (Win 10) just quarantined Monthly Budgets when I started KSP. Any other mod, I would have maybe given it a seconds thought (although not much more than that)... but not that one.

My theories (in decreasing order of likeliness)

1) KSP is triggering some faulty heuristics behaviour in Windows Defender,  and MB just got the blame because thats what it was loading at the time.

2) Defender has gone rogue, and is randomly flagging unsigned DLLs.

3) I'm actually writing spyware and infecting myself with it.

On second thoughts, it's definitely number three.
Me too popped up Sunday eve, same as member SIRAD

Looks like this is simply a false positive on the part of the virus detector.  Detailed answer here from @Squelch:

Executive summary, as I understand it:

  • No, there's no virus in KSP, this is a false alarm.
  • The problem is with the antivirus software, not with KSP, so there's nothing Squad can do about it.  It's the antivirus software that needs fixing in this case.
